The Mangabal I and 14angabal II complexes comprise two mafic-ultramaflc differentiated bodÍes, originated in separate chambers by processes of low pressure fractional crys tallization of a tholeiÍtic basaltÍc magma. They intruded a definite level of the sialic basement, represented in the area by gneissic and calc-silicate rocks, interpreted as belonging to the Goiás Basal Complex.
Although tectonicalLy deformed and partÍally recrys tallized, the compLexes still preserve relict igneous features, simi lar to those described for stratiform igneous complexes . In conformity with such features and according to the exlsting models for igneous stratiform complexes, the original stratl- graphyc sequence can be reconstructed as follows:
